title: Ticket #3780: Python htcondor.Collector.query fails "TypeError: No to_python
description:
The Python htcondor.Collector.query method fails when it is expected to return a list of results.

The following example is based on the example at http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/v8.0/6_8Python_Bindings.html#SECTION00782000000000000000 

>>> coll = htcondor.Collector("condor.cs.wisc.edu")
>>> coll
<htcondor.Collector object at 0x7fd7175f5260>
>>> results = coll.query(condor.AdTypes.Startd, "true", ["Name"])
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
NameError: name 'condor' is not defined
>>> results = coll.query(htcondor.AdTypes.Startd, "true", ["Name"])
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: No to_python (by-value) converter found for C++ type: boost::shared_ptr<ClassAdWrapper>
>>> results = coll.query(htcondor.AdTypes.Startd)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: No to_python (by-value) converter found for C++ type: boost::shared_ptr<ClassAdWrapper>
remarks:
2013-Aug-08 12:53:34 by bbockelm:
Fix in V8_1-gt3780 branch has been verified by Andrew Lahiff and Brian (using reproduction instructions on condor-users mail list). Pushing to master.

2013-Aug-21 11:18:39 by johnkn:
REVIEW: approved for stable.
check_ins:
2013-Aug-16 10:13   Check-in [37250]: edit 8.0.2 version history item ===GT=== #3780 (By Karen Miller )

2013-Aug-08 16:58   Check-in [37137]: Changes from Brian Bockelman for #3780 . Make pyclassad a shared library to make python bindings work. Also, change two messages command to STATUS level to avoid output to stderr. (By Tim Theisen )
2013-Aug-08 10:48   Check-in [37126]: Define Boost_PYTHON_LIBRARY for UW-style builds. #3780 (By Brian Bockelman )
2013-Aug-04 19:56   Check-in [37092]: Make pyclassad a shared library again. #3780 Fixes type converters in htcondor module. With a static pyclassad, the htcondor module and classad module thought their copy of "ClassAdWrapper" was unique. (By Brian Bockelman )
creator: adesmet
